# autoscroll(with:)

**Instance Method**

Scrolls the clip view proportionally to `theEvent`’s distance outside of it.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor func autoscroll(with event: NSEvent) -> Bool
```

## Discussion

`theEvent`‘s location should be expressed in the window’s base coordinate system (which it normally is), not the receiving [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSClipView]. Returns [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/true] if any scrolling is performed; otherwise returns [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/false].

Never invoke this method directly; instead, the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSScrollView]’s document view should repeatedly send itself [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSView/autoscroll(with:)] messages when the pointer is dragged outside the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSScrollView]‘s frame during a modal event loop initiated by a mouse-down event. The [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSView] class implements [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSView/autoscroll(with:)] to forward the message to the receiver’s superview; thus the message is ultimately forwarded to the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSClipView].

## Scrolling

- **scroll(to:)**: Changes the origin of the clip view’s bounds rectangle to `newOrigin`.
- **constrainScroll(_:)**: Returns a scroll point adjusted from the proposed new origin, if necessary, to guarantee the view will lie within its document view.
- **constrainBoundsRect(_:)**: Constrains the bounds of the clip view while the user is magnifying and scrolling.
